description: The group, representing about 38,000 subway and bus workers, plans to support William C. Thompson Jr., the former city comptroller, instead of Joseph J. Lhota, the former chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.
title: Transit Union Spurns Lhota
title_page: Transit Union Spurns Lhota - The New York Times
text:
In January, when Joseph J. Lhota, the former chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, announced his run for mayor, the leader of the largest union of transit workers in the city was asked if the group would consider endorsing Mr. Lhota’s candidacy.
“Absolutely not,” John Samuelsen, the president of Transport Workers Union Local 100, said in an interview then.
He has kept his word.
The group, representing about 38,000 subway and bus workers, plans to support William C. Thompson Jr., the former city comptroller, according to a union official with knowledge of the selection.
The decision is expected to be announced at a news conference on Tuesday, the official said.
Mr. Thompson said in a statement that “after being shut out for over a decade,” the city’s workers “will have a friend in City Hall.”
